intro: Stillingia lineata var. obtusifolia, commonly known as bluntleaf stillingia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often rounded or blunt at the tips. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is typically found in moist, wooded areas and is often associated with other shade-tolerant flora.
